description.original: This is a Pandoc export plugin for Obsidian. It provides commands to export to formats like DOCX, ePub and PDF.
description.translation: This is a Pandoc export plugin for Obsidian. It provides commands to export to formats like DOCX, ePub and PDF.

dict.Notice(\"Failed to load custom Pandoc CS: Notice("Failed to load custom Pandoc CSS file: " + settings.customCSSFile)
dict.Notice(\"Successfully exported via Pando: Notice("Successfully exported via Pandoc to " + outputFile)
dict.Notice(\"Exported via Pandoc to \" + out: Notice("Exported via Pandoc to " + outputFile + " with warnings")
dict..error(\"Pandoc plugin encountered an er: .error("Pandoc plugin encountered an error trying to load an embedded note: " + e.toString()
dict..setDesc(\"This local CSS file will be r: .setDesc("This local CSS file will be read and injected into HTML exports. Use an absolute path or a path relative to the vault.")
dict..setDesc(\"This applies app & plugin CSS: .setDesc("This applies app & plugin CSS to HTML exports, but the files become a little bigger.")
dict..setDesc(\"This controls how [[wiki-link: .setDesc("This controls how [[wiki-links]] are formatted. Doesn't affect HTML output.")
dict..setDesc(\"Export from markdown, or from: .setDesc("Export from markdown, or from the HTML visible in Obsidian? HTML supports fancy plugin features, markdown supports Pandoc features like citations.")
dict..setDesc(\"Absolute path to an export fo: .setDesc("Absolute path to an export folder, like 'C:UsersExampleDocuments' or '/home/user/zettelkasten'. If left blank, files are saved next to where they were exported from.")
dict..setDesc(\"Doesn't apply to HTML exports: .setDesc("Doesn't apply to HTML exports. Using the CLI will have slightly different results due to how this plugin works.")
dict..setDesc(\"Optional override for Pandoc': .setDesc("Optional override for Pandoc's path if you have command not found issues. On Mac/Linux use the output of 'which pandoc' in a terminal; on Windows use the output of 'Get-Command pandoc' in powershell.")
dict..setDesc(\"Optional override for pdflate: .setDesc("Optional override for pdflatex's path. Same as above but with 'which pdflatex'")
dict..setDesc(\"Add extra command line argume: .setDesc("Add extra command line arguments so you can use templates or bibliographies. Newlines are turned into spaces")
